objective.problem: Claude Code projects often lack consistent quality standards, project structure, and delivery practices, leading to code that may have bugs, poor documentation, unclear objectives, and inconsistent organization across different projects.
objective.target_user: Myself (JC) working on Claude Code projects across multiple repositories, and potentially other developers who want to maintain consistent quality standards in their AI-assisted development workflows.
objective.solution: A toolkit consisting of three MCP servers (Memory, Quality, Project), a CLAUDE.md standards file, quality gate scripts, and retrofit tools that can be copied into any Claude Code project to enforce objective clarification, quality standards, minimal root structure, and proper documentation practices. Self-learning AI assistant with memory persistence across sessions that makes granular, small changes (≤30 lines) to maintain development standards while supporting 24/7 autonomous coding capability The absolute minimum includes: CLAUDE.md file with project standards, quality gate script that blocks bad commits, and project objective clarification at project start. Features NOT in v1: fully autonomous 24hr coding (that's v2), automatic code refactoring, AI-generated tests
objective.success_metrics: Successfully retrofit at least 3 existing Claude Code projects with the toolkit, all projects pass quality gates consistently, project objectives are clearly defined with clarity scores >80, minimal root structure is maintained (≤5 folders), and the toolkit can be installed and used in a new project in under 10 minutes. For production/live projects, the toolkit has a light touch without affecting existing functionality, whereas non-live projects can have full implementation of best practices including structural changes.
objective.constraints: Now - version 1 should be ready immediately for use in retrofitting existing projects

objective_clarification.initial_description: A living best practice toolkit that continuously evolves by researching and integrating the latest tools, processes, and techniques for delivering superb quality systems using Claude Code and AI-assisted development. The toolkit enforces standards through MCP servers, quality gates, and automated workflows, while regularly being updated with discoveries from the internet, research, and real-world usage.

problem_1.answer: Claude Code projects lack consistent quality standards, structure, and delivery practices. Developers repeatedly make the same mistakes, miss opportunities to use better tools and techniques, and don't have a systematic way to enforce excellence. This toolkit solves that by providing enforced standards, automated quality gates, and continuously updated best practices from ongoing research.

target_user_1.answer: Solo developers and small teams using Claude Code for software development. Specifically: (1) The project owner (jc) who uses this toolkit across multiple projects, (2) Claude Code AI assistants that enforce these standards during development, and (3) Any developer retrofitting existing projects with quality enforcement and best practices.

solution_1.answer: A living toolkit with: (1) Four MCP servers (Memory, Quality, Project, Learning) that enforce standards and persist context, (2) Quality gates that block commits until standards are met, (3) CLAUDE.md standards documentation, (4) Eight slash commands for workflows, (5) Retrofit tools to install toolkit into existing projects, (6) A continuous research process that regularly searches for and integrates new tools, techniques, and best practices discovered online or through usage, (7) Kimi K2 integration for enhanced quality verification.

success_metrics_1.answer: Success metrics: (1) Number of projects successfully retrofitted with toolkit (target: 5+), (2) Quality gate pass rate in retrofitted projects (target: >90%), (3) Frequency of toolkit updates with new discoveries (target: monthly research cycles), (4) Reduction in bugs/rework in projects using toolkit (measured by git commits), (5) Test coverage in retrofitted projects (target: ≥80%), (6) Time saved by automated workflows and slash commands, (7) Number of new techniques/tools integrated from research.

constraints_1.answer: Version 1.0 is already released (November 2024). Current phase: Continuous improvement and evolution. No fixed timeline - this is an ongoing living project that evolves indefinitely. Monthly research cycles to discover and integrate new best practices. Immediate next phase: Complete test coverage, integrate Kimi K2 verification, establish research workflow.
